summary: This document is a chronological log of psychological observations and suicide risk assessments conducted on Jeffrey Epstein while he was in custody at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in July and August 2019. It details his mental state, complaints about confinement, interactions with staff and his cellmate, and the incident on July 23, 2019, where he was found with a string loosely around his neck. The log concludes with the note that he was found unresponsive and hanging in his cell on August 10, 2019.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of all psychological observations and suicide risk assessments. He is documented denying suicidality repeatedly, complaining about prison conditions, and discussing his legal case and future plans.

persons.name: Dr. Miller
persons.context: A psychologist who conducted multiple intake screenings, suicide risk assessments, and psychological observation contacts with Epstein. Documented Epstein's complaints and mental status.

persons.name: Dr. Imeri
persons.context: A psychologist who conducted suicide risk assessments and psychological observation contacts with Epstein, including after the July 23rd neck incident.

persons.name: Dr. Schlessinger
persons.context: Conducted an intake screening of Epstein on July 8, 2019, noting no significant mental health history or symptoms.

persons.name: Dr. DiMisa
persons.context: Conducted a post-suicide watch report on July 24, 2019, after the neck incident, documenting Epstein's account and denial of suicidality.

persons.name: Dr. Avena
persons.context: Conducted a psychological observation follow-up session on July 31, 2019, where Epstein reported getting along with his cellmate.

connections.description: Clinical relationship where Dr. Miller assessed Epstein's mental health and suicide risk on multiple occasions. Epstein made numerous complaints about confinement to her.
Clinical relationship where Dr. Imeri assessed Epstein's mental health and suicide risk, including after the July 23rd incident.
Epstein reported his cellmate was agitated, called him a pedophile, and was 'playing with a bed sheet' around the time of the July 23rd incident. Epstein later reported getting along with a cellmate.
Epstein was present with his Palm Beach attorney during a conference where he mocked Dr. Miller about being placed on suicide watch.

events.title: Neck Incident on Suicide Watch
events.description: Epstein was placed on suicide watch after a string was found loosely hanging from around his neck. He claimed no memory of the event, suggesting his cellmate may have been involved.

events.title: Intake Screening and Placement on Psychological Observation
events.description: Following a court appearance, Epstein was placed on psychological observation as a precautionary measure after consultation with the Central Office.

events.title: Extended Suicide Risk Assessment
events.description: Dr. Miller conducted a 45-minute suicide risk assessment. Epstein denied suicidality, was future-oriented, and spoke about his life and case. Recommended he remain on observation.

events.title: Epstein Found Unresponsive
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive and hanging in his SHU cell at 6:30 a.m., ten days after being removed from constant observation.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) - implied primary location
keyFacts: On July 23, 2019, Epstein was placed on suicide watch after a string was found loosely around his neck; he claimed no memory of how it got there and suggested his cellmate might have been involved.
Epstein repeatedly and adamantly denied being suicidal to multiple psychologists, stating he had too much to live for and wanted to fight his legal case.
Epstein expressed fear of his cellmate, who had called him a pedophile and was reportedly agitated, around the time of the July 23rd incident.
The psychological observation log details numerous complaints from Epstein about prison conditions, including noise, uniforms, medication, and legal visit procedures.
Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive and hanging in his SHU cell on the morning of August 10, 2019.
